project.description: Run pacemaker-cts tests. Useful only for cloud that was built by mkcloud and which has 3 nodes cluster e.g. 1a, 1b, 2b, 6a, Mandatory parameter: hw_number <!-- Managed by Jenkins Job Builder -->

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: hw_number
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Mandatory, number of the QA cloud server

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: scenario_name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Optional; scenario name which typically is an integer with a single letter

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: scenario_job_name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Optional; name of the scenario jenkins job that is used to trigger this job

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: scenario_build_number
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Optional; scenario build number that triggered this job

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash admin=crowbar$hw_number; cloud=qa$hw_number;
# get nodes names node1=`ssh $admin ssh controller1 hostname` node2=`ssh $admin ssh controller2 hostname` node3=`ssh $admin ssh controller3 hostname`
export artifacts_dir=$WORKSPACE/.artifacts rm -rf $artifacts_dir mkdir -p $artifacts_dir touch $artifacts_dir/.ignore
# pacemaker-cts preparation script
cat > /tmp/pacemaker_cts_prepare <<EOSCRIPT zypper ar dir:///srv/tftpboot/suse-12.2/x86_64/repos/SLE12-SP2-HA-Updates SLES12-SP2-HA-Updates zypper ar dir:///srv/tftpboot/suse-12.2/x86_64/repos/SLE12-SP2-HA-Pool SLE12-SP2-HA-Pool zypper ref zypper -n in pacemaker-cts EOSCRIPT
# copy pacemaker-cts preparation script into crowbar node scp /tmp/pacemaker_cts_prepare root@$admin:/tmp
# install pacemaker-cts utility on the crowbar node ssh root@$admin bash /tmp/pacemaker_cts_prepare
# copy pacemaker-cts preparation script to every node in the cluster for i in controller{1..3}; do ssh root@$admin scp /tmp/pacemaker_cts_prepare $i:/tmp ; done
# install pacemaker-cts on each controller node in the cluster for i in controller{1..3}; do ssh root@$admin ssh $i bash /tmp/pacemaker_cts_prepare ; done
ssh -T root@$admin << EOF
# obtaining credentials source .openrc
node1=$node1 node2=$node2 node3=$node3
# run pacemaker-cts on the crowbar node /usr/share/pacemaker/tests/cts/CTSlab.py --nodes ''$node1' '$node2' '$node3'' --at-boot 0 --benchmark --stonith-type ipmi --no-loop-tests --no-unsafe-tests --fencing openstack --once
EOF ret=$?
